alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 4:02PM PST until March 02 at 8:31AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Green River Near Auburn affecting King County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Showers will diminish today and will not contribute to rising river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 30000.0 cfs, the Snoqualmie River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands and roads along the river from the town of Snoqualmie downstream through Fall City. Roads that may become flooded include Fall City-Carnation...Tolt Hill... and Novelty Flats Roads. This river level on the Snoqualmie corresponds roughly to a phase 3 flood in the King County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM PST Tuesday the flow was 30100.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 PM PST Tuesday was 38500.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is receding and fall below flood flow tonight and continue to fall. - Flood flow is 20000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34200.0 cfs on 02/19/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1145 PM PST.
